FOTO: Kekeringan Sungai Mekong Terparah Selama 3 Dekade
01 Nov 2019, 18:33 by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA/ AFP, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia
Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Debit air di Sungai Mekong, Thailand untuk pertama kalinya menyusut sangat parah dalam kurun waktu 30 tahun terakhir.


Debit air di sungai mekong, Thailand untuk pertama kalinya menyusut parah. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



Penurunan debit air merupakan rekor terparah sepanjang sejarah. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



Komisi Sungai Mekong (MRC) mencatat ketinggan air pada periode Juni hingga Oktober merupakan yang terendah dalam kurun waktu hampir 30 tahun terakhir. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



Aliran anak sungai Mekong di Nong Khai, Laos mengalami penurunan sekitar satu meter, atau lebih dangkal dari rata-rata. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



Warga yang mendiami aliran sungai Mekong mengatakan penurunan debit air terjadi karena musim kemaran dan adanya proyek pembangunan bendungan. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



Proyek serupa juga tengah dilakukan oleh Laos dan Kamboja yang memperparah kondisi sungai Mekong. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



Sungai selebar satu kilometer ini telah menyusut hingga memunculkan batuan besar dan lapisan yang menutupi genangan air berlumpur. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



Tepian yang menjadi pembatas daerah penangkapan ikan antara Laos dan Thailand ini dikeluhkan oleh para nelayan. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)

PHOTO: The Mekong River Drought was the worst for 3 decades
01 Nov 2019, 18:33 by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia
Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Water discharge in the Mekong River, Thailand for the first time has shrunk very badly in the last 30 years.


Water discharge in the Mekong river, Thailand for the first time shrank severely. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



The decline in water discharge is the worst record in history. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



The Mekong River Commission (MRC) recorded that water levels in the June to October period were the lowest in nearly 30 years. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



The Mekong tributary flow in Nong Khai, Laos has decreased by about one meter, or shallower than average. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



Residents who inhabit the Mekong river said the decrease in water discharge occurred due to the dry season and the construction of a dam project. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



Similar projects are also being carried out by Laos and Cambodia which have worsened the condition of the Mekong river. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



This one-kilometer wide river has shrunk to reveal large rocks and layers that cover muddy puddles. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)



The border which is the boundary of the fishing area between Laos and Thailand is complained by fishermen. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)
